summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing the preparation and delivery of a laptop for Ghislaine Maxwell while she was detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MDC). The laptop was purchased from Amazon, configured to meet Bureau of Prisons (BOP) security standards, and was intended to potentially hold discovery materials for her defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom a laptop is being prepared and configured while she is detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MDC). Her attorneys requested discovery be loaded onto the device.

events.title: Amazon Laptop Order for Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, places an order on Amazon.com for a laptop, DVD drive, and Microsoft Office software, intended for Ghislaine Maxwell's use in detention.

events.title: Laptop Prepared for MDC Delivery
events.description: A laptop is configured and tested to meet BOP standards, with all electronic communication capabilities (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Ethernet) removed. It is made ready for delivery to the Metropolitan Correctional Center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office purchased a laptop for Ghislaine Maxwell while she was detained at MDC in November 2020.
The laptop was specially configured by authorities to have no Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, or Ethernet capabilities to meet Bureau of Prisons security standards.
Maxwell's defense attorneys requested that her discovery materials be loaded onto the laptop if possible.
The email chain shows coordination between prosecution staff regarding the logistics of delivering the secured laptop to the MDC warden.
The document reveals the procedural steps taken by the government to facilitate Maxwell's access to discovery while maintaining secure detention conditions.
